meanings.definition: To surpass in handling or managing
meanings.sent1: She was able to outhandle the heavy box with ease.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outhandle his opponents in the game.
meanings.sent3: The young boy tried to outhandle the tricky puzzle, but it was too difficult for him.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outhandle difficult customers made her a valuable employee.
meanings.sent5: The skilled juggler could outhandle any number of balls thrown at him.

meanings.definition: To outdo in skill or ability in handling
meanings.sent1: The experienced chef can outhandle any kitchen task effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outhandle any challenge that comes her way.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to outhandle the disappearing act, but the rabbit refused to cooperate.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking allowed him to outhandle the unexpected situation.
meanings.sent5: The talented musician could outhandle any musical instrument he picked up.

meanings.definition: To outperform in managing or dealing with a situation
meanings.sent1: The team captain knew how to outhandle the pressure during the final match.
meanings.sent2: She always finds a way to outhandle any crisis that arises.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to outhandle the case, but the clues were too confusing.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outhandle difficult clients made her a top salesperson.
meanings.sent5: The skilled negotiator could outhandle any tough negotiation.
